page.title: 01FLITWICK 1985.
page.content: THE LAND IN OUR SURVEY IS MAINLY FARM LAND, APART FROM THE VILLAGE OF STEPPINGLEY AND THE LARGE VILLAGE OF FLITWICK, WHICH DOMINATES FOUR OF THE SQUARES TO THE SOUTH-WEST. FLITWICK HAS A POPULATION OF APPROXIMATELY 8 800. IT IS SITUATED ON THE A5120 ROAD BETWEEN LUTON AND BEDFORD, 40 MILES NORTH OF LONDON. FLITWICK HAS A MAIN LINE RAIL STATION. FLITWICK DATES FROM SAXON TIMES. THE RIVER FLIT FLOWS THROUGH THE VILLAGE. IT IS SERVED BY THREE LOWER SCHOOLS, AND ONE MIDDLE SCHOOL, WOODLAND. ALSO INCLUDED IN OUR SURVEY SQUARES IS REDBOURNE UPPER SCHOOL, AMPTHILL. THE CHARACTER OF THE VILLAGE HAS CHANGED OVER THE PAST FEW DECADES WITH THE BUILDING OF LARGE COUNCIL AND PRIVATE RESIDENTIAL ESTATES. FLITWICK HAS A LARGE TESCO SUPERMARKET AND OTHER SHOPS FOR DAILY NEEDS.
